intro: Lens culinaris subsp. tomentosus, commonly known as the hairy lentil, is a subspecies of the common lentil native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, lens-shaped seeds. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil. Its foliage is often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. This subspecies is less commonly cultivated than the standard lentil but is valued for its unique texture and flavor in certain traditional cuisines.
